page.content:
Goals for this Course

  • Provide state and local adult education leaders with the framework, tools, and contextual strategies to build and expand partnerships, with an emphasis on employers.
  • Advance the design, delivery, and outcomes of adult career pathways by enhancing work-based learning and employment opportunities across the entire spectrum of adult career pathways programs.


Course Description

The purpose of the course is to equip adult education leaders with a modernized approach to building effective employer partnerships and thereby improve the design and delivery of adult career pathways programs.

The introduction to the course begins by defining adult career pathways, describing what high-value partnerships look like, and examining engagement through an opportunity and equity lens.

Using a “future of work” perspective will help state and local leaders formulate action plans and better understand the shifts in the economy driving the increasing need to form these partnerships.

 

Course Objectives

Upon completion of this course, participants will be able to:

  • Leverage areas of strength regarding employer and stakeholder engagement as a baseline to build the skills and competencies that are valued now and will be valued in the future and to advance more equitable adult career pathways;
  • Describe the interrelatedness of business, education, and training as a system in order to create partnership strategies to support adult career pathways and the success of students; and
  • Implement the most important employer engagement strategies from this course and set of resources by starting to outline an Employer and Stakeholder Partnerships Action Plan containing concrete steps following the course.

 

Course Organization

There are five units in this course:

  1. Realizing the Promise of Adult Career Pathways
  2. Initiating and Building an Ecosystem of Stakeholder Partnerships
  3. Building and Sustaining Employer Partnerships
  4. Leveraging Employer Partnerships to Advance Workforce Readiness
  5. Completing Capstone Activities and Concluding the Course

The course is organized to include a glossary, core content, learning checks, and links to resources. The course also contains handouts.
